definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
(conjunction used to express contrast with a previous clause) but/then/standard/norm/principle/to imitate/to follow/classifier for written items
happy on the one hand, but worried on the other (idiom)
pinyin: yi1 ze2 yi3 xi3 , yi1 ze2 yi3 you1

definition: happy on the one hand, but worried on the other (idiom)
pinyin: yi1 ze2 yi3 xi3 , yi1 ze2 yi3 you1

sentences.english: A moving legend was often told around the area of Zhongxian County, Sichuan Province.
sentences.chinese: 在四川忠县一带，则流传着一则感人肺腑的传说。

sentences.english: He wrote a jingle for a shampoo advert.
sentences.chinese: 他为一则洗发露广告编了一首歌。

sentences.english: There is an interesting story about Steinway craftsmen .
sentences.chinese: 这里有一则关于施坦威工匠的有趣故事。

sentences.english: When I was learning German, there was a cartoon very cute.
sentences.chinese: 我以前学德文的时候，看过一则漫画很有趣。

sentences.english: A unique scenery here, hidden but beautiful spot.
sentences.chinese: 一则此处风光独特，别有洞天。

sentences.english: And this is based on the story, the mythical story of a king who killed his father and married his mother.
sentences.chinese: 名字来自于一个故事，一则国王弑父娶母的希腊神话。

sentences.english: Sam sees a " Help Wanted" sign outside a fast-food restaurant and goes inside.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆在一家快餐店外看到一则招聘启事，他走进店里。

sentences.english: Write an ad for rent and an ad for being wanted.
sentences.chinese: 让学生写一则租房广告和求租广告。

sentences.english: The answering machine bleeped and I left my message.
sentences.chinese: 应答器发出哔哔声，我留下了一则口信。

sentences.english: Professor Zhang's empirical prescription "Anshen Decoction"is introduced, and one representative case is presented.
sentences.chinese: 介绍其经验方安神汤，并举一则典型病例以说明。

sentences.english: No people believe it literally, that it was a beautiful myth.
sentences.chinese: 没有人会真的相信这些故事，它仅是一则神话而已。

sentences.english: Four days later, a headline about a burglary attracted his attention.
sentences.chinese: 四天后，一则有关盗窃案的标题新闻引起了他的注意。

sentences.english: One day, she saw an advertisement about ORBIS.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，她看到一则有关奥比斯的广告。

sentences.english: Once in the "Harvard family motto" let the rabbit on the run saw a fable.
sentences.chinese: 曾经在《哈佛家训》上看过一则让兔子奔跑的寓言。

sentences.english: 'If you want to leave, just leave!' said another.
sentences.chinese: 另外一则评论说，如果你想走就走好了。

sentences.english: I wish to insert an advertisement in your newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 我希望在你们的报纸上登一则广告。

definition: (of video clips, rumors etc) to circulate on the Internet
widely spread/widely rumored/stories abound/(sb's exploits are) widely circulated
old anecdote/stories passed on from former times
not alone but in pairs (idiom, usually derog.); not a unique occurrence/it's not the only case
to be called/to be known as
